alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 27 at 9:32AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Pike. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkhorn City, Lookout, Rockhouse, Ashcamp, Marrowbone, Virgie, Jonancy, Dorton, Belcher, Myra, Cedarville, Speight and Toonerville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
